intro: Mariscus angustatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences and are typically pink or reddish in color. Mariscus angustatus is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
